cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)
cards.originalText: Counts as both forest and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.originalText: All islands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Tundra
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)
cards.originalText: Counts as both islands and plains and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {U} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tunnel
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroys 1 wall. Target wall cannot be regenerated.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.originalText: Caster may tap or untap any one land, creature, or artifact in play.

cards.name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys
cards.text:
Trample
Two-Headed Giant of Foriys can block an additional creature.
cards.originalText:
Trample
May block two attacking creatures; divide damage between them however controller likes.
cards.flavor: None know if this Giant is the result of aberrant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

cards.name: Underground Sea
cards.text: ({T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.)
cards.originalText: Counts as both swamp and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {B} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +2/+1.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return creature to owner's hand; enchantments on creature are CARD ed. Unsummon cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

cards.name: Uthden Troll
cards.text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
cards.originalText: {R} Regenerates
cards.flavor:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da
hurt'll disappear."
—Traditional

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

cards.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
cards.text: You may have Vesuvan Doppelganger enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it doesn't copy that creature's color and it gains "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature except it doesn't copy that creature's color. If you do, this creature gains this ability."
cards.originalText: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all normal characteristics (except color) of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppelganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

cards.name: Veteran Bodyguard
cards.text: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.
cards.originalText: Unless Bodyguard is tapped, any damage done to you by unblocked creatures is done instead to Bodyguard. You may not take this damage yourself, though you can prevent it if possible.
cards.flavor: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

cards.name: Volcanic Eruption
cards.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.
cards.originalText: Destroys X mountains of your choice, and does X damage to each player and each creature in play.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: "This ‘standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {B} Regenerates
cards.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.originalText: {G} Regenerates
cards.flavor:
"What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."
 —Conrad Aiken

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R} +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

cards.name: Wall of Ice
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: "And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—/ The ice was all between."/—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Wall of Stone
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {U} +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during upkeep.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Warp Artifact does 1 damage to target artifact's controller at start of each turn.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText: Target creature loses -2/-1; if this drops the creature's toughness below 1, it is dead.

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain the power to fly.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.text: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.
cards.originalText: Both players must discard their hands and draw seven new cards.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.originalText: Protection from black, first strike
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: White Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from white.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.originalText: When tapped, target land provides 1 green mana in addition to the mana it normally provides.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: Flying; {B} Regenerates
cards.flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
cards.originalText: Players can untap only one land each during untap phase. Creatures and artifacts are untapped as normal.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any green spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Word of Command
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. You control that player until Word of Command finishes resolving. The player plays that card if able. While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they're from lands he or she controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands he or she controls and/or play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.
cards.originalText: You may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. Opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. This spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: All creatures in play are destroyed and cannot regenerate.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.originalText: All zombies in play gain swampwalk and "{B} Regenerates" for as long as this card remains in play.
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
